alert.note: Alert for Hansford; Hutchinson; Lipscomb; Moore; Ochiltree; Roberts; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:03AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Beaver, southeastern Texas, Lipscomb, northern Hutchinson, Hansford, eastern Sherman, northern Roberts, Ochiltree and northeastern Moore Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 302 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Slapout to Perryton to 13 miles northeast of Sunray. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Perryton, Spearman, Lipscomb, Booker, Gruver, Follett, Darrouzett, Wolf Creek Park, Elmwood, Farnsworth, Waka, Pringle, Morse, Bryans Corner and Balko. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma...and the Panhandle of Texas.
